name: S3 Export Plugin
description: Export PostHog events to Amazon S3 on ingestion.

config.markdown: Read [the documentation](https://github.com/PostHog/s3-export-plugin) here for instructions in getting these keys.

config.name: S3 filename prefix
config.hint: For example "backups/posthog/" (with a trailing slash) to store the backups in a separate folder.

config.name: Upload at most every X minutes
config.hint: If there are events to upload and this many minutes has passed since the last upload, send the events to S3. The value must be between 1 and 60 minutes.

config.name: Maximum upload size in megabytes
config.hint: Always keep the uploaded files below this size limit, uploading more frequently than the time limit if needed. Events are kept in memory until then, so make sure your server has enough of it. The value must be between 1 and 100 MB.

config.name: Events to ignore
config.hint: Comma separated list of events to ignore

config.name: Format of uploaded files
config.hint: jsonl: text files with one event per line as JSON

config.name: Compress uploaded files
config.hint: Compressing events before uploading them to S3 keeps costs down. The upload size limits are applied *before* the compression.
